metadata.Title: CVE-2019-18889 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in Symfony 3.4.0 through 3.4.34, 4.2.0 through4.2.11, and 4.3.0 through 4.3.7. Serializing certain cache adapterinterfaces could result in remote code injection. This is related tosymfony/cache.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-18889` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

php-symfony - 4.3.8+dfsg-1ubuntu1
php-symfony-amazon-mailer - 4.3.8+dfsg-1ubuntu1
php-symfony-amazon-sqs-messenger - 4.3.8+dfsg-1ubuntu1
php-symfony-amqp-messenger - 4.3.8+dfsg-1ubuntu1

criterions.comment: symfony package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.3.8+dfsg-1ubuntu1').
